conformance-summary.sql:
-- Current conformance by category
-- Shows pass rate for each test category

SELECT 
    category,
    COUNT(*) as total,
    SUM(CASE WHEN status='PASS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as passed,
    ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN status='PASS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 1) as pass_rate
FROM test_files
GROUP BY category
ORDER BY category;

recent-runs.sql:
-- Recent test runs
-- Shows the last 10 test runs with pass rates

SELECT 
    run_id,
    started_at,
    passed,
    failed,
    ROUND(100.0 * passed / total_files, 1) as pass_rate
FROM test_runs
ORDER BY started_at DESC
LIMIT 10;

failing-index-tests.sql:
-- Find failing index tests
-- Lists index-related tests that are currently failing

SELECT file_path, subcategory
FROM test_files
WHERE category='index' AND status='FAIL'
ORDER BY subcategory, file_path
LIMIT 20;

test-progress-join.sql:
-- Test file progress (JOIN example)
-- Shows current status vs last run status for evidence tests

SELECT 
    tf.file_path,
    tf.status as current_status,
    tr.status as last_run_status,
    tr.tested_at as last_tested
FROM test_files tf
LEFT JOIN test_results tr ON tf.file_path = tr.file_path
WHERE tf.category = 'evidence'
ORDER BY tf.file_path;

total-conformance.sql:
-- Total conformance percentage
-- Overall pass rate across all tests

SELECT 
    COUNT(*) as total_tests,
    SUM(CASE WHEN status='PASS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as passed_tests,
    SUM(CASE WHEN status='FAIL' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as failed_tests,
    ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN status='PASS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 1) as pass_rate
FROM test_files;

slowest-tests.sql:
-- Find slowest tests
-- Tests with longest execution times

SELECT 
    file_path,
    duration_ms,
    status
FROM test_results
WHERE run_id = (SELECT MAX(run_id) FROM test_runs)
ORDER BY duration_ms DESC
LIMIT 10;

error-analysis.sql:
-- Error message analysis
-- Group failures by error type

SELECT 
    error_message,
    COUNT(*) as occurrence_count
FROM test_results
WHERE status='FAIL' AND error_message IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY error_message
ORDER BY COUNT(*) DESC
LIMIT 10;

never-passed.sql:
-- Tests that have never passed
-- Find problem areas that need work

SELECT 
    file_path,
    category,
    subcategory
FROM test_files
WHERE status='FAIL' AND last_passed IS NULL
ORDER BY category, file_path;
